website_summaries.verdict: Gorilla Carts is known for manufacturing top-notch equipment, and this cart is an example of the company's excellent quality — an all-around great option for garden enthusiasts.
pros: Built for the serious gardener, thanks to the superior steel craftsmanship, capable wheels, and 1,000-pound capacity
Has a durable handle and sides that can be removed to convert it to a flatbed design that's easy to load and unload
cons: Has the tendency to be a bit "tippy" when empty
Tires have been known to occasionally lose air

website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a heavy-duty cart-flatbed trailer, this is the one.
pros: Large, strong cart with huge load capacity
Can be towed by ATV or lawn tractor
cons: A few owners report faults in the paint finish

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly cheaply built.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cart because it claimed to be heavy duty which it is not. The sides are made out of very thin metal and I have had to pound them straight several times in the month I have had this cart. The metal is so light gauge I could simply slap it back into shape (close as possible)with my hands. The sides are soooooo cheap. I'm not using this cart for work or ever approaching its claimed max weight. Really not satisfied at all. I thought somthing called a Gorilla cart would be way tougher. You can see the sides are made by c shape pieces of thin metal welded together to make square stock.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: My new Garden Cart
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for setup were clear and easy to follow. This is a very sturdy utility cart. I just received the cart and set it up and so have not had time to use it for hauling stuff for my garden. But, the little I have used it impressed me. It has a large bed area as seen in the picture. This silver garden card is much larger than the average sized blue cart.
customer_reviews.author: KC Hougen

customer_reviews.title: A great Utility Cart
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed many utility carts looking for construction and durability. Reviewed the various options that the Gorilla company offered and decided with their Utility Cart because of the size of tires and basic overall dimensions of 29.5" x 49". I found that the bed was just right for my first spring project large enough to hold the six bags of mulch and three bags of planting dirt with the sides remaining in place. Plenty of room for my tools and supplies to the all the flower beds. No concerns with the weight or ease of moving from place to place across the lawn. I have added photos for the various loads so far.
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, tough, functional cart!
customer_reviews.text: We have a small farm and use this cart to haul feed and water around in the winter through the snow. 4 five gallon buckets of water plus buckets of feed. Have used it through one winter so far and it's as good as new. Can do a 360 degree turn no problem and the handle is adjustable for taller or shorter people, and the handle can hook up to your tractor to pull around as well. We have four of the green carts like this one around the farm that the wheels have broken off or they do not turn anymore. We are extremely happy and satisfied with this cart so far! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned one that would not hold air in tire got a dented beat up one
customer_reviews.text: Received the first one and one of the tires would not hold air. Amazon did a great job in getting it returned and sending out a replacement cart, the 2nd one was all bent up. Figured dented is better then not holding air, Would most likely purchase a different brand if we purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Lewis

customer_reviews.title: destroyed box and missing pull handle and hardware
customer_reviews.text: driver brought it all the way up next to my garage out of sight, upon opening i found no pull handle and no hardware (no nuts, washers, wheel clips, etc.) the box had a big hole in the bottom. these are great carts and i got a good discount but the handle alone is $29. i tried to return this but return assume the box is still good, which it it isnt. not sure how to proceed.
customer_reviews.author: Grajin

customer_reviews.title: Sent to me broken
customer_reviews.text: It came in the mail with several metal prints damaged and bent which makes taking the walls on and off quite difficult. It also makes the walls sort of bend rather than stay straight. I think it's ridiculous that an item in this price range with supposed good quality would be sent to a customer looking like this. The tires also came already needing more air and I'm pretty sure they're used because only one tire still has tread. I need it for an event this weekend otherwise I'd return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cart for yard and utility work around home at a great price for the quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, simple, functional design, heavy duty parts and construction. Easily switches from pull handle to tractor hitch. Tires can be inflated to 30 psi with maximum loading of 300 lb per wheel / 1000 lb rating for the cart. We did encounter a packing issue wherein the shipping box had three significant holes in it and we heard loose parts rattling around inside the box -- some of the bolts, washers, and cotter pins came loose from the bubble-wrapped parts card. Luckily none were missing, but we sent photos to Amazon. Five stars anyway because we would have given it seven if we could for quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago John

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: My wife LOVES it! Very easy to put together. I greased all connections thoroughly while assembling, knowing that this thing will be outside in the weather, a lot! It's BIG, can easily haul the heaviest stuff, and fit-and-finish is very good; good welds, good paint job, everything fits and is square. Only thing it needs is a brake! I'm going to make a simple wheel stop brake to put on ours to keep it from rolling downhill. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Spock

customer_reviews.title: Price is to high for what you get
customer_reviews.text: It's a good heavy duty cart but not a very good coating for rust prevention. I had the cart about 3 days ( it was outside, but covered well with a heavy duty tarp) and it already had a lot of surface rust all over. So I bought a can of automotive undercoating and sprayed the entire cart. And as far as the insert for the floor of the cart, no good.. you might as well put cardboard on the floor because the piece they give you is thinner than cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jim E.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised (but bigger than I had pictured in my mind).
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty cart. A bit bigger than I had pictured in my mind, but it is as advertised. Only issue I had/have is that I had a similar model that lasted for years but rusted out where the 'mesh' sides meet the frame and where the handle pivoted the front wheels (the handle/pivot point finally broke and couldn't be repaired). I caulked where the mesh is held into the frame on this one so hopefully that rusting will not occur. I will grease/lube the wheel pivot points, etc., more often but this unit has a better design/construction there anyway so I expect many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Goodtime Charlie, VA

customer_reviews.title: ... to find a cart that is going to be perfect. This one is good
customer_reviews.text: It seems awfully tough to find a cart that is going to be perfect. This one is good. I'm going to give it only 4 stars because the sides are made of nearly paper thin metal that I think won't last long once the paint is compromised and rust sets in. I also was underimpressed with the black floor mat. Most carts appear not to come with this ma, so that is a bonus, but this one is really thin. Most carts come with theses same tires, and man they stink BAD for days. Luckily I'm using it for a low impact use and it will be under cover all the time, so it should last and work for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Connor

customer_reviews.title: Need to spray clear rustoleum to prevent rust
customer_reviews.text: I'll be getting a lot of use out of this! I bought it for an event where I had to haul some things out to our vendor booth at a park; but I will mostly be using it for my garden projects. So, it will be getting wet and dirty; and it is starting to rust. But it is very sturdy; and well made. I like that it will not hold water like my other garden carts & that I can hook it up to the atv and haul plants around.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: poor paint job
customer_reviews.text: Just assembled it and the cart seems sturdy, pulls easily. Easy assembly. The side panels came damaged in shipping, due in part to poorly designed packaging. Customer support promised to ship replacements when they become available. I was disappointed in the paint job. It appears they spray painted over rusty metal parts. The paint is thin and rust is seeping through. i like the option to pull by hand or garden tractor. removable sides are a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A.

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: First one came damaged bent and dented parts. Replacement came quickly. Like other review said the mesh bad is just tack welded from the bottom. No way it can carry weight long term. Now 16 months of use and it is rusting and bed has come loose from the frame due to bad welding and design. Only 4 months past the limited warranty so out of luck I guess. More like a chimp cart than a gorilla cart.
customer_reviews.author: B. Craft

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't that easy to out together. Then I was hauling feed bags down my driveway and the handle pushed against the side piece. Yes, bent it. That should have been my warning that it wasn't very durable! If you actually have to use it to move heavy items, this isn't the one for you! 400 lb of feed kills it! It came apart where the handle connects to the wheels! Expensive and NOT DURABLE! From what I head, not even going to contact gorilla.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Turner

customer_reviews.title: Rust and bending
customer_reviews.text: 1000lbs capacity my @$$. First use hauling wood, the metal grating on the bottom started bending and snapping. Come to find out that after a weekend of use, it had started rusting. Not even just where it had broke, but there are rust spots all over it including in an area that had never had anything carried in it, the handle. Get something different. If they had used higher quality materials, this would be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great wagon...I may buy another one...
customer_reviews.text: A rather heavy but well-made wagon. The assembly was easy and quick, actually, I enjoyed it and I usually hate assemblies. While I did read the assembly booklet, I really didn't need to, it was that easy. Aside from the sturdiness of the wagon, I really loved the handle/hitch as it was also sturdy and easily turned and pulled the wagon. While I followed the directions fully, I did incorporate one thing additionally, ie, I added some grease onto the wheel spindles and the wheel bearings.
customer_reviews.author: danleep11

customer_reviews.title: Hope you get all of your parts
customer_reviews.text: Packet of parts to assemble was missing bolts needed to attach the handle. They had clearly been torn out of the packaging. There is no option to request a replacement of just those parts without returning the entire cart, which would obviously be far more work than going down to the hardware store to figure out and buy the bolts I need. Might be a great cart once I can attach its handle, but it's useless junk as it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great construction!
customer_reviews.text: Great construction! Easy to assemble. Quality materials and pieces. My only complaint is that I'd like some sort of cushion for the handle/bar when placed up against the basket. I can easily see it scratching and bending the top of the basket if any pressure is put on it when in this position. The plastic mat is also pretty flimsy, though it seems to do the job. I cut a 2x4 piece of carpet to use when I need something a bit more durable. Still, overall, very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: E. Nelsen

customer_reviews.title: Best product I've seen
customer_reviews.text: What is not to like? I am an engineer, so I can appreciate what I think are the best thought-out assembly instructions I've ever seen. Straightforward, understandable and clear. Parts/fasteners packaged to match instructions. Oh, and by the way: this is a high quality unit. I love it! I've been buying on Amazon for many years, and this the best product I've ever purchased. To say that I recommend it is a huge understatement. It isn't cheap, but you get MORE than you pay for. I will never hesitate to buy from this company! Charles Clark
customer_reviews.author: Littlecharles

customer_reviews.title: Why did i wait so long!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use to move mulch. I have a large flower garden and mulch twice a year. Instead of making multiple trips I was able to stack 6 bags of mulch on the cart. It probably would have held more, but I wanted to keep the load lighter for my sake. I have since used this to haul rock, load it up with tools and even used it to move a fireplace! This cart was very easy to assemble and took me 20 minutes. The sides come off really easily and I usually use it without them. It also turns really well and I am able to easily maneuver through my yard and around obstacles. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: kristi

customer_reviews.title: Beware the Tires
customer_reviews.text: We love these carts and use them everyday around the farm. Mostly they haul tools or firewood. The reason for the three-star rating is that the tire inner tubes are trash. We quickly had to replace every single tire, one by one, each costing about $15. Our recommendation is to factor that into your price considerations. After replacing with quality tubes we no longer have that problem. My father has one of these carts from years ago that did not have this problem. He has had it for 7 years, never replaced a tire, and claims to have pumped them up maybe twice in that time.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander T. Long

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hardware, great option to a trailer
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to my prior review which was focused on shipping package. Very pleased with this product/cart. Hardware is top notch, something many manufacturers don’t pay attention to. We are using with our ATV to assist with hauling yard debris to the curb. Also to move tools from our storage shed to the garage or where needed in the yard. Smaller footprint versus a trailer so takes up less space and still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: very manueverable on pneumatic tires.  Dual use Tow Tongue is a great feature.
customer_reviews.text: Great, mounted my electric start portable generator on it,(250 lbs). Now easily pulled behind my garden tractor anywhere on the property to provide electric power for fence repair, etc. One slight concern is the mesh on the bed, as well as the four hinged side panels, are not really welded as solidly as they could, and should be. Just tack welded every 8-12 inches along and should be attached more solidly.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay O.

customer_reviews.title: Good Stout Cart
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed at the right price. The straight forward assembly task gives good evidence of the solid construction. This will easily handle the load of two 100lb bales of hay. Picked this for the deck size which will accommodate oversize square bales. Stable carriage on 4 balloon tires.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Dawes

customer_reviews.title: All nuts are same size on direction #1
customer_reviews.text: I am upset because I was sent the same size nuts on direction 1. The nuts will not fit front axle because they are all the same size
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Box arrived looking awful, but product was all intact and complete
customer_reviews.text: The cart is over 75 pounds and the box usually comes kind of beat up. Putting that aside, all the parts were in the box and it was fairly easy to assemble. The first thing we did was to bring the wheels of a air pump at a tire center to fill them. Then put the cart together in about 30 minutes. One of the side gates is a little bent, but can be easily straightened and does not affect the operation. I definitely recommend this very heavy sturdy cart and is serving the purpose for which it was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: tuff_customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty wagon at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This cart is exactly what we needed to haul stuff around in the yard while doing some landscaping. It was easy to put together, highly maneuverable, and versatile since the sides are removable. We can even attach it to the lawnmower when the wagon we already have is too heavy. The only thing I may change is getting solid rubber tires instead of the pneumatic. Other than that I’m very pleased with the construction and price.
customer_reviews.author: BERTA

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I use this cart to transport bark from my driveway to the back yard so I can spread it around. Works better than a wheelbarrow. I then place the cart in my garage and store supplies and other things to maximize the space.
customer_reviews.author: Read Right

customer_reviews.title: Carts great, tires not so much
customer_reviews.text: Having this cart on our homestead has been a great help. The metal part has been sturdy and easy to maneuver around. The one disappointing part about this product is the tires. We've had 2 flats in 4 months and it was an extra $100 to swap the tires to "solid no-flat" tires. I wish I would have known this before purchasing... I would have just found a cart with solid tires to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble but two came in damaged boxes.
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to assemble. Shipping box was badly damaged upon receipt. No instruction manual or parts list. All tires were flat when received. Two would hold air, two would not hold air. It sounded like the the tubes were pinched in manufacturing. Amazon could send but did exchange it for a new one. That box was damaged also but with enough tape was able to remove the two tires/wheels to make first one complete. Have not used it much yet but I do not think it will work better than my old ones which cast half as much.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. C.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I use my cart for moving firewood around my yard and found it to be easily damaged and even easier to bend the sides. But the cart did assemble easily. It just does not stand up to the gorilla name. It should be named chipmunk or mouse or something like that. The wire mesh was punctured without me even noticing how I did it. I also broke the frame of the cart and I never came close to the weight capacity of the cart. I would look for a better cart than this one if I had it to do over again. And thanks to a poor quality cart I will have to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice wagon
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is one beefy cart that will more than serve the purpose around the house and yard. The larger tires navigate well over rough ground. The tongue hitch is lightweight compared to the rest of the construction and bent easily. Also the removable sides are a nice feature with easy latches. However the side panels become flimsy when removing the end panel to carry long items. Finally, the plastic bottom liner is worthless, too thin and ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars for assembly because my husband said the directions were a little vague but he didn't swear alot or ask me to help so I think that's fair. I needed a cart I could store outside, could be pulled over multiple surfaces, including thick gravel, and not too heavy. This cart is perfect for all of that. I really, really like this cart and I'm so glad I made this purchase. It's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie C.,  Boise,  ID

customer_reviews.title: Can't even hold 125# let alone 1000.
customer_reviews.text: First time used, it couldn't even hold a 125# protein tub without busting holes in the metal mesh. Other than the weak metal mesh, the wagon would be pretty good. Guess i will try replacing the metal mesh with something stronger and see if it holds. Hate wasting money.
customer_reviews.author: D Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made, a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I love this thing! I'm planning on using it mostly for moving firewood but it will be great for all kinds of yard work. The box was a little beat up, but when I opened it I could see someone put a lot of thought into protecting the parts during shipping. Assembly was easy, took about half an hour. The design is simple and strong and it looks well-made. The sides remove easily, a clever design. The pulling handle can also be easily removed without tools so you can hitch it to a lawn tractor. I got it as a "gold box" deal, heavily discounted, with free shipping via Prime, a heck of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Paul from Santa Rosa

customer_reviews.title: It's a cart
customer_reviews.text: It is a cart made out of steel from China. Not difficult to assemble and it works for light loads. I am sure under perfect circumstances it could carry the weight it says, but probably much less in the real world if you don't want to break it. Using it for branches and stuff around the yard. I have no doubt it will rust if you leave it outside long enough.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: Maneuverable and easy-pulling
customer_reviews.text: This cart makes hauling things from my basement-level driveway to my ground-level yard a breeze. It leaves no marks in my yard, and the small turn radius makes maneuvering into place easy. (Seriously, you could do donuts with this thing.) The liner is stiff plastic rather than flexible as I'd expected. That hasn't been an issue, but I have some concerns about the long-term durability of the liner. That said, I have no regrets on buying this, and I think I've even convinced my neighbors to get one!
customer_reviews.author: A. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great Utility Cart! It can be towed or pulled by hand which is a great feature.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart! Its very durable and can hold up to 1000lbs. Its easy to move and can turn on a dime. I have carried everything in this cart from dirt to bricks to kids. Its sturdy and very easy to maneuver when its full of stuff. Depending on the weight in the cart it could get heavy to pull when in tall grass but that can be overcome by flipping the handle into a hitch and hooking it up to your mower or other towing device!! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It's a wagon
customer_reviews.text: It's a wagon, not a trailer. If you've ever tried to back a wagon, then enough said about when it comes to maneuverability. That being said, I knew what I was buying. Quality is good. Seems sturdy, but it will need repainted before long if left outside. Already seeing some rust. That's why I knocked off one star on sturdiness. Other than that, it's a great product. Overall, I would recommend this wagon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of garden equipment
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart; I use every time I work in the garden. I can easily move around heavy bags of mulch and compost; haul large garden tools; move pots full of plants. I even use it to haul trash, recycling, and yard waste to the curb for pickup. It is sturdy, maneuvers easily, and makes sharp turns without tipping over. Without this cart my gardening would be severely limited. I did not rate the ease of assembly because I had someone else assemble it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Love this cart
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, easy to assemble, easy to move around, small enough to tuck away behind the bushes. I use it to clean up the yard – branches, debris – cart groceries to the house, move pots and plants, big bags of mulch, garden produce, landscaping rocks, heavy tools, miscellaneous odds and ends too numerous to carry in hand...it's a back saver.
customer_reviews.author: Joan I Williams SD

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to maneuver, but has a design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, and easy to drive and steer, but in the first 30 minutes of use, we had some welds on the wire bottom break loose. Whomever designed this chose to put the welds underneath the outside frame. That means there are spots where the welds are bearing the weight. I had a load approaching 200 pounds with 3 points of contact. One of the pressure points landed in between crossbars and near the outside frame, and broke several welds on the wire loose. I had to reposition the load to avoid further damage. If you have to haul something like split firewood, this would work well. If you have items that are dense and compact, use with care.
customer_reviews.author: Matt F.

customer_reviews.title: Not as tough as the description makes it out to be.
customer_reviews.text: The cart itself is great. But the sides are very flimsy. And the handle bent the first time we used it with the lawn tractor. And yes, we followed the instructions on how to connect it to the tow system on the tractor. Very disappointing. Since the handle is bent, it is no longer able to be hand pulled. Also, the framing is starting to get rust spots on it. Even though it has never been used in the rain and it's kept in a dry shop.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: The Only Cart You’ll Ever Need
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new cart to transport things from the storage shed at the back of our property to the house. We keep all of our holiday decorations in that shed, all the flower pots for the deck and house and our outdoor furniture. The cart saves us on the number of trips we need to make to move our things back and forth. It’s heavy duty and maneuvers easily over all our outdoor surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo Plumadore

customer_reviews.title: Extra large .superior maneuverability sharp turns no problem great price
customer_reviews.text: This cart berry big frame verry durable but removable steal mesh sides are not as strong or thick of steal as I thought would be but love easy handle removal of all sides that just levers .overall great price n great wagon for my needs ....good purchase am satisfied.I'd recommend storring in shed or garage won't take long for metal mesh sides to rust n break or at least store sides inside out of weather.
customer_reviews.author: grandma

customer_reviews.title: The cart itself is okay but...
customer_reviews.text: the tires are junk. We bought and assembled this in the Fall of 2019. It was parked and unused all winter. By Spring 2020 the tires were rotted so badly they leaked air on all sides.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Long

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: Our yard is up and down so we got this cart to make it easier to move stuff about. It was an excellent purchase. We've used it to move buckets of coal, garden rubbish, top soil, groceries - we have to come down steps to get from the car to the back door so this baby has made bring down groceries far, far easier as we just fill it up and pull round and down the grass to the back door. If you want to get a truck for the yard or whatever, check this one out - worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Lon Chaney III

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first day
customer_reviews.text: Not rated for 1000lbs. I put one bag of mulch in it and the side broke off on the first day. The sides have 2 small spots that sit inside the base. Mine bent right away. It would be great if the seller could hook me up with a replacement side. Easy to assemble. Good tires. If you turn to sharp with mower it tips over. All around a good product other than the design of the sides front and back gates.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: I love the cart
customer_reviews.text: I love the cart, but it did come damaged. The right vertical side was bent a bit. It was easy to put together, with a few tools and works great. It has a tight turning radius. Packaging was 3 stars, product 4-5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Garabed A. Sarkessian

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. The large tires make it easy to maneuver and easy to pull when fully loaded. We have been using it to move tree limbs and debris in the mountains on uneven ground with a slight slope. Works great. The only less than ideal thing is that I have the back piece off so that the longest wood limbs can hang out the back, which leaves the side pieces poorly supported. Just the small inserts on the sides and the latching to the front piece holding it together. Working well for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: WOW! This cart is amazing! Huge and Durable, maneuvers better than my car.
customer_reviews.text: Best cart ever. I had no idea it would be so large! turns like no other wagon I've used, huge durable tires. Sides come off easily and go back easily so when it is loaded with needles, you just pull off the one side, push it all out and pop the side back on. You could easily put a grown adult in it, and drag them around the forest. (I prefer to pull around kids, but now I can fit at least 3 of them!)
customer_reviews.author: Ariel French

customer_reviews.title: Great light duty cart, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Cart was easy to assemble and works as advertised. I received in excellent condition with one exception a flat tire. I contacted customer service and they quickly responded. I have this cart for several months now and my review has not changed, I like the cart so much i purchsed the polycart as well. Both work well and were easy to assemble. I would recommend Gorilla carts to anyone looking for a well made inexpensive cart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't count on this cart to last if it is going to sit for awhile.
customer_reviews.text: Overall sturdiness is great. I used it at a large school site ( just a few times ) and then it sat in my class room. When I pulled it out of storage all of the tires had flattened. No big deal, I will inflate them. Upon trying to inflate them they literally blew a potion of the rubber out of each tire. The wagon sat for 6 months. I am now just now writing a review because it is cheaper to buy a new wagon than to purchase 4 tires.
customer_reviews.author: Patti C.

customer_reviews.title: great wagon
customer_reviews.text: this is a great wagon i use it anytime i go shopping wheels very easily even in tight places right thru the front door and right back out also we like the fact that we can take the sides off when we have wider thing to carry big tires also make it easy to move best thing we have bought in years wish we had done long time ago can't really say enough about it great!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good cart of heavy wood loads
customer_reviews.text: Two initial projects included hauling big logs from a downed maple tree. Not sure how much weight was piled in but the cart was heaped and had no trouble with it. The big tires didn't get stuck in fairly water saturated soil and nothing bent under the weight. Placed a tarp in the back and used cart to haul a couple loads of dirt to fill in a hole. Convinced this is going to be a good replacement for my dead wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: A. Que

customer_reviews.title: Great Cart follow up
customer_reviews.text: This a replacement cart to one we purchased 15years ago ( difference brand). Very easy to assemble and great maneuverability. Love this cart!!! Follow up... just about 3 months out the cart is showing rust with nominal use.
customer_reviews.author: Crissymarie King

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, useful, easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 67 year old woman and put this cart together in about 45 minutes using 2 regular pliers and needle-nose pliers. Very simple. The instructions are all diagrams, so no language issues. It's a very sturdy cart, easy to use. I got it to bring groceries from the car to the house, and also for yard work. Sides slip on and off easily. Also, cudos to Amazon for shipping a second cart after my first one went missing in shipment or was delivered to the wrong address. Thanks, Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn C.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: The thing is easy to pull and move around tight location. The sides are much weaker then I would expect for something that is rated for so much weight. They were damaged just getting shipped to my house, (not part of my rating or the companies fault)...but could see that they would not hold up to a major side load equivalent to the rating.
customer_reviews.author: JRZ Monkey King

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, large, great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd gorilla cart, this being the newest addition. Love it!! Easy to assemble, sturdy. Lots of space. We use our cars for hauling household goods in, and in the garden. I cant wait to hook it to the lawnmower to move the heavy yard stuff around. We might have to buy the dump version next. If you buy this you need a plan on where you will store it, it's a large cart. We stand them up on their frames against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cart!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome purchase. I am a single 57 year young female and I was able to assemble this in about 15 minutes without any difficulty and it has been a pleasure to use. I use it for my gardening and also to haul limbs and debris to the burn pile. If I have a trunk load of groceries, I also use it to haul everything in one trip to the house instead of making several trips. It is very very helpful and handy and one of the best purchases I have made this year!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda U.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Built Solid!
customer_reviews.text: I got my Gorilla Cart this week and the first thing you notice is the box is heavy! It only took 30 minutes to assembly once I completed the unboxing. It has a very solid feel too it. I've not put it to work yet but I'm looking forward to putting it work soon cleaning out my garage and hauling stuff to the curb!
customer_reviews.author: Virtualcowboy

customer_reviews.title: I love this cart!
customer_reviews.text: We have a family farm so we have a lot of hauling to do. I bought two of these and they've saved our backs soooo many times. We use them constantly, every single day. The crisscross metal at the bottom bends easily so if you stand on it where there's no bar under it, it will bend so it's not for kids to ride in unless you put a board across the bottom to spread the weight but it holds up to a lot of beating.

customer_reviews.title: It is, what it is..
customer_reviews.text: If you need a cart, a low quality, entry level cart, its a good value. We have a fleet of this style cart, and its by in far on the top end of the bar. Keep in mind, its still an offshore product, the expanded metal, its very very soft and easily penetrated. Several cars with holes in the expended metal floors. It its what it is. Came shipped in the OE box, was not reboxed, and arrive significantly damage, due to its use, it really does not matter, so it was not returned. I did not reflect my review rating to including the shipping incident. Tires stink like most off shore rubber.
customer_reviews.author: It's da' Meathead

customer_reviews.title: VERY STURDY
customer_reviews.text: My daughter assembled it in 35 minutes. The instructions are primarily pictures, not much text. She used needle nose pliers, wrenches. The cart rolls easily. The large tires are great & give the cart more height so you don't have to bend over as far. My son thinks it should have a hand brake.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.G.B. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The box came like it was going to be junk but when I opened it up everything was good and there was nothing out of place. The assembly was fairly easy for one person just make sure you have 2 wrenches. Looks good overall, will update once using it if it really is 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Martir

customer_reviews.title: Very good cart with missing hardware/manual
customer_reviews.text: The cart we received was, obviously, a returned item. All of the hardware was loose in the box, and there was no manual. We found an online assembly manual, and from that were able to discern that there was a washer missing from the loose pile in the box. We needed to hit the hardware store for that washer prior to completing assembly. Other than that frustration, we really like the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Woods-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great cart!
customer_reviews.text: This cart is very sturdy and heavy. I had a broken piece on mine due to shipping and the box being broken. I contacted the manufacturer and they sent me a new piece quickly and at no cost. Their customer service is great and quick to respond. Overall, I really like the cart!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: We love this cart!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this cart for about a year and a half. We love this thing! It's been a life saver as we moved bags of rock around, wood we've cut from a fallen tree, and all manner of misc. items. The only problem is getting it away from my father long enough to actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: tntricia

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor adventures on the farm
customer_reviews.text: It took only 15 minutes to get this cart from the box and fully assembled. It definitely can haul extreme amounts of weight. I’ve used it to haul farm equipment, groceries, sporting equipment, and farm animals. The large wheels are an asset being able to maneuver easily over tall grass, mud, swampy areas, sand, and bumpy terrain. The only suggestion of improvement are the sturdiness of the side walls. They can easily get unlatched and disengage from the cart. This is a cart that I would buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Farm life

customer_reviews.title: Another Disappointing Order
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the worst disappointments for our kids. We received this item in a ripped box; now that we pulled the parts out, there are no bolts, knots, pins; nothing at all. This is unacceptable! Amazon should do something about this. YOUR ITEM IS OCCUPYING OUR SIDESTEP FOR OVER A MONTH, IN ITS ORIGINAL RIPPED BOX. ASK YOUR ARRIER TO BRING ALONG A BOX TO PUT IT IN AND DO IT SOON. THANKS.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Barati Darmian

customer_reviews.title: Love this cart
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I hook it up and take my family on rides with my lawnmower ever night. Holds my 3 toddlers and wife with no problem. Only negative is the. Side pieces are bent out of the box. I recommended to my friend to buy one and same problem. They hammered back straight with no issue... but was sad to see 2 for 2 bent from the box.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory F.

customer_reviews.title: It works very well and I can easily load a whole cart from basement then move it ...
customer_reviews.text: Took me around 2 hours to put this cart up since I am not handy and always looking for correct tools. It works very well and I can easily load a whole cart from basement then move it to my basement through back door. It's easy to use, heavy duty. 2 thumbs up. Oh, I need to mention: there are installation video on youtube for this cart, I have to check that video when I was stuck by one stop in the instruction book. That video is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: E.L.

customer_reviews.title: I bought on April, broken in 2 month.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 2 month(only like 1 day every week). The handle bar connection is broken already.
customer_reviews.author: TBC

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CART!!!
customer_reviews.text: This cart has been a huge helper with so many things! I haul heavy things with it frequently, use it while doing yard work, use it for potting plants. It is very durable and well made, this thing is tough! My Yard is large and full of sandy soil and lots of tree roots, this cart has no problems with the terrain. I also love the removable sides. The handle also converts to attach it to the mower! It was a huge help to remove all the debris after a hurricane left a huge mess. I use this thing all the time!!
customer_reviews.author: Casey205

customer_reviews.title: Badly damaged upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to the reviews about the cart arriving damaged. With the way they packaged it, it's no wonder. There was no barrier between the bolts and the side pieces. The bolts tore through the wires and the frame is also bent on the base and sides. There would be no way to put this together, as bent as it is. The black plastic cover for the bottom is broken from the bolts as well. Now I have to take this huge pile of junk to UPS to return it.
customer_reviews.author: chancy fabrizio

customer_reviews.title: If I had seen it in a store, I probably would have chosen a solid body rather than the grated one. I am sure it won't last.
customer_reviews.text: box was very damaged and some dents in the gate had to be hammered out in order to assemble. But the most annoying was one of the tires was deflated and stem was damaged so it would not hold air. Now, they are sending another wagon, which I don't need. I just asked for the tire. And I am expected to mail back the first one??? It weighs a ton, aside from the fact that it is assembled and I am not about to disassemble it. Should have bought one in a store!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Derr

customer_reviews.title: It was relatively easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I had previously had the smaller version of this cart and decided I would upgrade! This cart is a small monster! I only hope I can pull it around on our uneven ground. I am looking forward to having something that will hold up to some hard use. It was relatively easy to put together, I did need a socket wrench as I am not strong enough to tighten the large screws.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It was really hard to put some of it together but we got it figured out. It has been a lifesaver for me as I am older. I can attach it to my lawn mower to haul things around or pull it to get my dog food and chicken feed from the car to the barn. Despite how hard it was to put together, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Miller

customer_reviews.title: Tough, flexible.
customer_reviews.text: The design of the removable gates makes this a very flexible product. I use 7 keyboards on stage, several of which are very heavy, especially the 88-weighted key piano. It is too long use the front and back gates, but with bungee straps, I can still use the side gates to keep my keyboards from sliding around and fit some more gear in the sides. It is a monster to make room for in the van, but I would hate to move my rig very far without it. rbs
customer_reviews.author: Robert and Jenny Scott

customer_reviews.title: Sides dont stay on when layed down.
customer_reviews.text: Wish the sides stayed on hinges when laying them down. You have to take the side you want down completely off. If you want 2 sides on, it has to be sides that connect on the corners like and L shape. You cant have just 2 sides on parallel next to each other. You also cant have just 1 side on. Sturdy cart but I wish the mat on the bottom was more of a rubber that a thin plastic. Overall good deal for the price I paid when it was discounted.
customer_reviews.author: Briar

customer_reviews.title: My NEW wagon
customer_reviews.text: It did arrive 4 days prior to the delivered by date of 7/1/2020 so that was nice. The box was in great condition however the Gorilla Cart decals got all jacked up! Easy to assemble I gave it 4 stars. It would have been much easier to assemble if the bolt for the handle was the correct length. The bolt is at least 3/8 - 1/2" short depending on the use of the 3 thread rule! In fact it did not even engage with the nylok portion of the lok-nut. And the matt they supplied will not last any decent length of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: We just received our cart. It came a few days after we had some major tree limbs taken down which yielded two cords of wood. We loaded up our Gorilla Cart and hauled the logs to our wood splitter and then to the wood crib. What a great piece of equipment; so much better than a wheelbarrow! We wonder how we ever did without it and how it will ease many tasks ahead. We recommend to anyone who wants a 'beefy' cart for hauling and wants to make fewer trips.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost and a reputable manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Came with a tire that wouldn't hold air. Manufacturer shipped out a new one FedEx right away.Great customer service.easy to assemble .Does exactly what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Not so heavy duty after all
customer_reviews.text: I have to question how heavy duty this cart really is. Please see broken side panel in picture. I intend to use this to carry camping equipment but I don't want to tear a hole in my tent.
customer_reviews.author: E. S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: The wheels and frame feels sturdy, though
customer_reviews.text: A little more flimsy than I expected. One of the spot welds holding the very light guage expanded metal floor down, didn't survive assembly. I expect to have to replace the floor, soon. The sides are just as flimsy. The wheels and frame feels sturdy, though. So far, I hauled 400lbs, and it seemed to handle that just fine. I would have liked to see a lot heavier expanded metal used.
customer_reviews.author: W C Genzer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a few months now, and we LOVE it. The handle turns around to hook to our lawn tractor. When the (2) grand-kids are bigger, we'll strap them in for a ride (there's room for them and a bunch of their stuff). Box came damaged, without the handle, and the company sent one right out when I contacted them. Easy to put together, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and easy to push/pull even when loaded down
customer_reviews.text: Very beefy cart! It is bigger than I expected. Works very well and easy to push/pull even when loaded down. The wheels almost roll too good. It is hard to get it to stay still unless you have it very flat ground. The only negative is that it was leaking rusty water after being left out in the rain. I kind of assumed this was the type of cart that could be left out in the weather occasionally. Make sure you tip it up to drain any rusty water if you leave it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Slyguy1017

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart and consider it one of the best investments I've ever spent my money on. I've had it for about 3 months now and have used to haul many things - fire wood/branches, huge pots of food, packs of water bottles, coolers, trash, rocks, fertilizer, etc... My favorite features on it - the big rugged tires, easy to maneuver handle, and removable sides.
customer_reviews.author: mytab

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to carry anything, just consider this instead of those flat ones with small plastic wheels. This is very quiet and consume little force on pitch and concrete road. If you go across grass, a lot more force is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gleamy Wolf Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Great Wagon
customer_reviews.text: Great wagon, however there were no assembly instructions enclosed. I found a good YouTube video from the manufacturer which explained the assembly perfectly. It was very easy to put together after watching the video. The wagon arrived with one flat tire, which after inflating held air fine. It was also slightly damaged in shipping but not enough to really matter much considering that it will be getting a lot of rough use which may scratch it up anyway.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Love this cart! It is so easy to put together, it took me less than 30 mins. The picture instructions were all I needed. Very sturdy and easy to move around. It's AWESOME! I love that the sides are so easy to remove. It's really a nice ride.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cart Rotten Tires
customer_reviews.text: Cart arrived this week and assembly was a breeze. All the tires felt very soft and were low on pressure. Went to fill them and 3 were fine. The last one had a large leak. Took the tire of the rim and discovered a cut on the sidewall. What a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mmmm

customer_reviews.title: EASY to Use and STRONG TOO.
customer_reviews.text: This cart is so easy to use. I had an issue with it when it first arrived and I called the company and the people there are JUST FANTASTIC! They shipped me what I needed and I couldnt be happier:) Thank You guys for great "gorilla" products and excellant customer service! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: EngS

customer_reviews.title: good strong cart
customer_reviews.text: very nice cart Only improvement would be shipping/packing material as our box arrived "destroyed" and one of our side panels was dented - this is a heavy unit and the thin cardboard box/shipping did not protect the cart well.....
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke after 15 months.
customer_reviews.text: Like the size and function of this cart. The big tires roll easily with 100+ pounds of rock in the cart. However, while working in the yard hauling rock, the handle snapped off. Turns out it was only tacked on by a couple of welds as opposed to being bolted on. Poor design. Will now reach out to Gorilla Carts to see if they can replace.
customer_reviews.author: Layman

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy for heavy duty work
customer_reviews.text: This was heavier than I expected. Had to have help moving it to the deck and assembling. However, it is very maneuverable and strong. I am able to haul large items as needed. Very good buy but be aware of its weight.
customer_reviews.author: Music Fan

customer_reviews.title: I have yet to see this cart, as I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to see this cart, as I bought it for my son who has a bit of acreage to tend to. I think it is his intention to attach it to his riding lawn mower to care for his upper meadow and the deer that frequent his place. I bought him the sturdiest one I could find on-line. I expect it to last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rose39

customer_reviews.title: Best thing we’ve ever bought for our garden/yard.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! It rolls right over uneven surfaces securely. It holds a ton yet maneuvers effortlessly. Turns on a dime. We replaced the thin, brittle bottom liner with a thick, spongey, sturdy one meant for farms and it adds a bit of grip so contents stay put. We use boxes inside it to haul dirt and construction debris. You can stack 10 or so bags of soil or feed in here and move it effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous 42

product_meta.title: Gorilla Carts GOR1001-COM Heavy-Duty Steel Utility Cart with Removable Sides, 1000-lbs. Capacity, Gray
product_meta.description: Size Name:1 pack| Color:GrayThe newly-designed Gorilla Carts Heavy-Duty Steel Utility Cart has been engineered to significantly reduce assembly times, making it quick and easy to put this cart to work. The new frame design improves maneuverability, increases ground clearance, and gives the cart a tighter turn radius, making it easy to move up to 1,000-pounds for gardening, farming, or any other outdoor jobs. The durable steel bed features removable sides that allow the cart to convert into a flatbed for moving larger materials like 2x4s, tree branches, or fence posts. The 13-inch pneumatic turf tires are designed to tackle any terrain, and the convertible 2-in-1 handle makes it simple to switch between pulling the cart by hand or towing behind a lawn tractor. Whether you’re an experienced farmer, a casual gardener or an occasional do-it-yourselfer, this utility cart will ensure that your outdoor projects go off without a hitch. The bed dimensions measure 49-inches by 24.5-inches, and the cart has an overall height of 44.1-inches and weighs 61.3-pounds. Gorilla Carts full line of products meets the needs of the light-duty homeowner as well as the commercial-duty professional user by offering a wide variety of carts in many sizes and weight capacities. The Gorilla Carts GOR1001 Heavy-Duty Steel Utility Cart comes with a 1-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Removable steel mesh sides for added versatility when carrying larger loads

Utility Cart exterior dimensions – 56.14" L x 24.9" W x 44.1" H | Bed dimensions – 49” L x 24.5” W | Weight – 61.5 | Weight limit – 1,000 lbs. | CU FT Capacity – 7 | Tire (Pneumatic) Size – 13” | Bore size – 5/8”
Padded 2-in-1 convertible handle can be pulled by hand or towed
New frame design allows for quick and easy assembly while offering improved maneuverability, rigidity, and ground clearance

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,200 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
